name: Hood Warfare
description:
Welcome to Detroit. Gang violence has become an epidemic, forcing all civilians and police to leave the city. All that remains are soldiers of the Bloods and Crips. The city has become an abandoned battlefield where gangs engage in large scale firefights known as "Hood Warfare". Gangs will fight whenever and wherever across the city.

Hood Warfare features classic FPS gameplay, reminiscent of the golden age of PC FPS games from the early 2000s.

Hood Warfare's Gamemodes Include:

Gang Warfare: A round-based mode where your team will clash in the streets of large maps with large teams. Each player only gets one life per round. Come up with strategy's with your team to win rounds.

Turf War. A gamemode where gangs fight for control of turf surrounding a map. Gangs will get points for every piece of turf they own. Eventually, the gang with the most turf points will win.

Chaos. Every man for himself. There is no loyalty to a gang in this mode. Kill or be killed to win.

Gangbang: Classic Bloods vs Crips firefight with the most points win.

3 Gang mode variants: Tired Of 2 teams? Switch it up with three. These modes feature the Bloods vs Crips vs Serpents, a new gang.


Hood Warfare features online play, however offline play is also supported with bots. Bots can also fill private or public lobby's if the host chooses to enable them.
Hood Warfare currently features 5 maps. Detroit City, Downtown, OldCity, The Suburbs, and Police Station. Each of these maps allow for a different type of playstyle and certain weapons may fit better for the job depending on the map.

Experience an advanced weather system featuring every season and weather condition imaginable during gameplay.
Hood Warfare features built-in voice chat, to chat with your team along with enemy's.

Level up your reputation by playing, and you will unlock various weapons.

Hood Warfare is currently in Early Access, and will receive various updates featuring more weapons and modes over time.

*DIsclaimer*
Hood Warfare nor Trapstargames promotes nor condones any form of real life gang violence. This game does not attempt to portray any real life events and is merely a work of fiction for entertainment purposes. The issues of gang violence are a complex issue that Hood Warfare does not attempt to replicate or promote. Like all video games, this is a piece of media for entertainment.
